intro: Galium brachycarpon, commonly known as dwarf bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes, forming dense mats. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Galium brachycarpon is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
